description:
I have been using the functionality where you can save a website as an app on my browser. I was missing the shortcuts and autocomplete of tags from windows and mobile, so i gave kuro a try, hoping that it would provide what a webpage cannot. 
- it did not -
the interface of Kuro feels identical to the saved webpage, with the exception that the side panel has different 'folders' and English as a language instead of the lanuage from my microsoft account. The shortcuts do not appear to work on my system, but kudo's for thinking about them and showing the option to modify them.
overall not really convincing me to stop using the website-as-an-app feature from my browser
summary: not much more than a chrome site-to-app

description: I've recently started using Microsoft ToDo on my mobile device and I'm delighted that I can use it on my Ubuntu desktop as well with this app. As other reviewers have said, it appears simply to make the 'ToDo' web page available within the app, but that's all I need. The app allows me to make the font larger, which is really handy for me: there is another app for 'ToDo' in the snap store which doesn't have that option, so I prefer this one.

I use ToDo privately and at work, as well, usually on Android and MS Windows. I didn't like the experience in the browser for ToDo compared to the native apps, and really missed it on my private laptop running Ubuntu.

Kuro gives me just what I need - big thanks to the developer!

装完以后都找不到图标，醉了。
装完以后都找不到图标，醉了。
summary: 装完以后都找不到图标，醉了
